TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IAssistance

Docs.summary: Provides a means for developers to create a customized help experience for users within Microsoft Office.

remarks.para: The Assistance property of an Application object returns an object. The object exposes methods that allow developers to display help topics in the Office Help Viewer or to display help topics that ship with Office in the Help window of the host application. Developers either pass specific Help IDs to the help system or pass specific search queries. Help IDs have to be explicitly added to the Help file in order for the Help ID to return the help topic.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ClearDefaultContext([in]string HelpId) runtime managed

Docs.param: The ID of the default help topic.
Docs.summary: Clears the default help topic previously defined in the method.

remarks.para: Executing this method will stop the default help topic from displaying when the user presses F1 or clicks the Help button in a dialog box.

The Assistance property of an Application object returns an object. The object exposes methods that allow developers to display help topics in the Office Help Viewer or to display help topics that ship with Office in the Help window of the host application. Developers either pass specific Help IDs to the help system or pass specific search queries. Help IDs have to be explicitly added to the Help file in order for the Help ID to return the help topic.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SearchHelp (string Query, string Scope = "");
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SearchHelp([in]string Query, [in]string Scope) runtime managed
Public Sub SearchHelp (Query As String, Optional Scope As String = "")

Docs.param: Represents the search keyword or phrase.
Optional, the namespace registered within the host application.
Docs.summary: Performs a search from the Office Help Viewer based on one or more keywords. Keywords can be a word or a phrase.

remarks.para: The Assistance property of an Application object returns an object. The object exposes methods that allow developers to display help topics in the Office Help Viewer or to display help topics that ship with Office in the Help window of the host application. Developers either pass specific Help IDs to the help system or pass specific search queries. Help IDs have to be explicitly added to the Help file in order for the Help ID to return the help topic.

The user can return more relevant help by narrowing the scope of the search, as long as the specified scope is applicable to the application. The following scopes are available within Microsoft Office applications. By default, the scope is set to the current application's namespace if a Null string ("") is passed as a parameter.

item.description: Access, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Project, Publisher, SharePoint Designer, Visio, and Word

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetDefaultContext([in]string HelpId) runtime managed

Docs.param: The ID of the default help topic.
Docs.summary: Sets a help topic as the default topic that will be displayed when the user opens a help window.

remarks.para: The help topic specified in this method will not be displayed if Office has already defined a default help topic in that scope. In addition, for some dialog boxes, regardless of whether an ID is passed by the method, the help topic that shipped with Office will be displayed when the user presses the F1 key or clicks the Help button. For example, if the user is in a custom dialog box and presses F1, a custom or built-in help topic will be displayed if one is specified by the developer. If no default ID is specified, the default built-in Office help topic will be displayed. Likewise, if the user is in the New Document dialog box, for example, the Office specified help topic will be displayed regardless of whether a different ID is passed by the method.

The Assistance property of an Application object returns an object. The object exposes methods that allow developers to display help topics in the Office Help Viewer or to display help topics that ship with Office in the Help window of the host application. Developers either pass specific Help IDs to the help system or pass specific search queries. Help IDs have to be explicitly added to the Help file in order for the Help ID to return the help topic.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ShowHelp (string HelpId = "", string Scope = "");
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ShowHelp([in]string HelpId, [in]string Scope) runtime managed
Public Sub ShowHelp (Optional HelpId As String = "", Optional Scope As String = "")

Docs.param: Optional, the ID of the help topic.
Optional, the namespace registered within the host application.
Docs.summary: Displays the help topic specified by its ID in the Office Help Viewer or, for help topics that ship with Office, in the Help window of the current Office application.

remarks.para: The Assistance property of an Application object returns an object. The object exposes methods that allow developers to display help topics in the Office Help Viewer or to display help topics that ship with Office in the Help window of the host application. Developers either pass specific Help IDs to the help system or pass specific search queries. Help IDs have to be explicitly added to the Help file in order for the Help ID to return the help topic.
The following scopes are available within the Microsoft Office applications. By default, the scope is set to the current application's namespace if a Null string ("") is passed as a parameter.

item.description: Access, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Project, Publisher, SharePoint Designer, Visio, and Word
